A 'horse hoof' is a structure surrounding the distal phalanx of the 3rd digit
(digit III of the basic pentadactyl limb of vertebrates, evolved into a single
weight-bearing digit in equids) of each of the four limbs of Equus species,
which is covered by complex soft tissue and keratinised (cornified) structures.
Since a single digit must bear the full proportion of the animal's weight that
is borne by that limb, the hoof is of vital importance to the horse. The phrase
"no hoof, no horse" underlines how much the health and the strength of the hoof
is crucial for horse soundness.
headings: Characters and functions of the external hoof structures
